parameters.desc: Change the output type to JSON, bash, or silent

subcommands.description: View Pantheon ASCII artwork
subcommands.longdesc:

<druplicon|fist|unicorn|wordpress>

subcommands.name: auth
subcommands.description: Authenticate to Pantheon and store a local secret token.

subcommands.name: login
subcommands.description: Log in as a user
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS
[<email>]
: Email address to log in as.

[--password=<value>]
: Log in non-interactively with this password. Useful for automation.

[--machine-token=<value>]
: Authenticates using a machine token from your dashboard. Stores the
  token for future use.

[--debug]
: dump call information when logging in.

subcommands.name: logout
subcommands.description: Log yourself out and remove the secret session key.

subcommands.name: whoami
subcommands.description: Find out what user you are logged in as.

subcommands.description: Get information about Terminus itself.

subcommands.description: Clear cached data
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--cache=<cache>]
: specific cache key to clear

subcommands.name: cmd-dump
subcommands.description: Dump the list of installed commands, as JSON.

subcommands.name: completions
subcommands.description: Generate tab completion strings.
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

--line=<line>
: The current command line to be executed

[--point=<point>]
: The index to the current cursor position relative to the beginning of
  the command

subcommands.name: console
subcommands.description: Instantiate a console within Terminus
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: name of site to load

subcommands.name: info
subcommands.description: Print various data about the CLI environment.
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--format=<format>]
: Accepted values: json

subcommands.name: param-dump
subcommands.description: Dump the list of global parameters, as JSON.

subcommands.name: session-clear
subcommands.description: Clear session data

subcommands.name: session-dump
subcommands.description: Dump session data

subcommands.name: version
subcommands.description: Print Terminus version.

subcommands.name: drush
subcommands.description: Invoke `drush` commands on a Pantheon development site
subcommands.longdesc:
<commands>...
: The Drush command you intend to run with its arguments, in quotes

[--site=<site>]
: The name (DNS shortname) of your site on Pantheon

[--env=<environment>]
: Your Pantheon environment. Default: dev

subcommands.name: help
subcommands.description: Get help on a certain command.
subcommands.longdesc:
[<commands>...]
: The command you want information on

[--recursive]
: Display full information on all subcommands and their subcommands

## EXAMPLES

    # get help for `sites` command
    terminus help sites

    # get help for `sites` command and all its subcommands
    terminus help sites --recursive

    # get help for `sites list` subcommand
    terminus help sites list

subcommands.name: instruments
subcommands.description: Show information for your Pantheon instruments

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: Show a list of your instruments on Pantheon

subcommands.name: machine-tokens
subcommands.description: Show information for your Pantheon machine tokens

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.description: Delete a machine token from your account
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS
[--machine-token-id=<id>]
: UUID or name of the site you want to delete

[--force]
: to skip the confirmations

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: Show a list of your macnine tokens on Pantheon

subcommands.name: organizations
subcommands.description: Show information for your Pantheon organizations

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: Show a list of your organizations on Pantheon

subcommands.name: sites
subcommands.description: List an organization's sites
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

<add|remove|list>
: subfunction to run

[--org=<id|name>]
: Organization UUID or name

[--tag=<tag>]
: Tag name to filter sites list by

[--site=<site>]
: Site to add to or remove from organization

subcommands.name: team
subcommands.description: List an organization's team members
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

<list|add-member|remove-member|change-role>
: Options are list, add-member, remove-member, and change-role.

[--org=<id|name>]
: Organization UUID or name

[--member=<email>]
: Email of the member to add. Member will receive an invite

[--role=<role>]
: Role for the new member to act as. Options are admin, team_member, and
  developer.

subcommands.name: site
subcommands.description: Actions to be taken on an individual site

subcommands.name: backups
subcommands.description: Get, load, create, or list backup information
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

<get|load|create|list|get-schedule|set-schedule|cancel-schedule>
: Function to run - get, load, create, list, get schedule, set schedule,
  or cancel schedule

[--site=<site>]
: Site to load

[--env=<env>]
: Environment to load

[--element=<code|files|db|all>]
: Element to download or create. `all` is only used for 'create'

[--to=<directory|file>]
: Absolute path of a directory or filename to save the downloaded backup to

[--file=<filename>]
: Select one of the files from the list subcommand. Only used for 'get'

[--latest]
: If set the latest backup will be selected automatically

[--keep-for]
: Number of days to keep this backup

[--day]
: Day of the week on which to run weekly backups

[--username]
: MySQL username (Used for site backups load --element=db)

[--password]
: MySQL password (Used for site backups load --element=db)

[--database]
: MySQL database name (Used for site backups load --element=db)

subcommands.name: clear-cache
subcommands.description: Clear all site caches
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: site to use

[--env=<env>]
: Environment to clear

## EXAMPLES
 terminus site clear-cache --site=mysite --env=live

subcommands.name: clone-content
subcommands.description: Overwrites the content (database and/or files) of one environment with
subcommands.longdesc:
content from another environment

## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Site to use

[--from-env]
: Environment you want to clone from

[--to-env]
: Environment you want to clone to

[--db-only]
: Clone only the the database

[--files-only]
: Clone only the files

subcommands.name: code
subcommands.description: Code related commands
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

<log|branches|diffstat|commit>
: options are log, branches, diffstat, commit

[--site=<site>]
: name of the site

[--env=<env>]
: site environment

[--message=<message>]
: message to use when committing on server changes

subcommands.name: complete-migration
subcommands.description: Completes a site migration in progress
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Name of the site for which to complete a migration

subcommands.name: connection-info
subcommands.description: Retrieve connection info for a specific environment
subcommands.longdesc:
e.g. git, sftp, mysql, redis

## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Name of the site from which to fetch connection info

[--env=<env>]
: Name of the specific environment from which to fetch connection info

[--field=<field>]
: Name of a specfic field in the connection info to return
  Choices are git_command, git_host, git_port, git_url, git_username,
  mysql_command, mysql_database, mysql_host, mysql_password, mysql_port,
  mysql_url, mysql_username, redis_command, redis_password, redis_port,
  redis_url, sftp_command, sftp_host, sftp_password, sftp_url, and
  sftp_username

subcommands.name: create-env
subcommands.description: Create a MultiDev environment
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Site to use

[--to-env=<env>]
: Name of environment to create

[--from-env=<env>]
: Environment clone content from, default = dev

subcommands.name: dashboard
subcommands.description: Open the Pantheon site dashboard in a browser
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: site dashboard to open

[--env=<env>]
: site environment to display in the dashboard

[--print]
: don't try to open the link, just print it

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.description: Delete a site from pantheon
subcommands.longdesc:

[--site=<site>]
: UUID or name of the site you want to delete

[--force]
: to skip the confirmations

subcommands.longdesc:

: Site to use

[--env=<env>]
: name of environment to delete

[--remove-branch]
: delete branch corresponding to env

subcommands.name: deploy
subcommands.description: Deploy dev environment to test or live
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Site to deploy from

[--env=<test|live>]
: Environment to deploy to (Test or Live)

[--sync-content]
: If deploying test, copy database and files from Live

[--cc]
: Clear cache after deploy?

[--updatedb]
: (Drupal only) run update.php after deploy

[--note=<note>]
: deploy log message

subcommands.name: drush-version
subcommands.description: see the current version of Drush being used
subcommands.longdesc:
[--site=<site>]
: The name of your site on Pantheon

[--env=<environment>]
: The Pantheon environment to check the Drush version of.
  Note: Leaving this blank will check the versions on all environments.

[--field=<field>]

[--site=<site>]
: Name of site to check

<list|add|remove|lookup|get-recommendations>

[--site=<site>]
: Site to use

[--env=<env>]
: environment to use

[--hostname=<hostname>]
: hostname to add

subcommands.description: Retrieve information about the site

: Environment you want to initialize

<info|add|remove>
: action to execute ( i.e. info, add, remove )

[--site=<site>]
: site name

[--env=<env>]
: site environment

[--username=<username>]
: your username

[--password=<password>]
: your password

[--site=<site>]
: site for which to retreive notifications

subcommands.name: organizations
subcommands.description: List site organizations
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

<list|add|remove>
: subfunction to run

[--site=<site>]
: Site's name

[--org=<name|id>]
: Organization to add/remove from membership, name or UUID

[--role=<role>]
: Max role for organization on this site ... default "team_member"

subcommands.name: owner
subcommands.description: Get the site owner
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Site to check

subcommands.name: redis
subcommands.description: Interacts with redis
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

<enable|disable|clear>
: Options are enable, disable, and clear.

[--site=<site>]
: site name

[--env=<env>]
: environment

## Examples

   terminus site redis clear --site=behat-tests --env=live
   terminus site redis enable --site=behat-tests
   terminus site redis disable --site=behat-tests

subcommands.name: set-connection-mode
subcommands.description: Change connection mode between SFTP and Git
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: name of the site

[--env=<env>]
: site environment

[--mode=<value>]
: set connection to sftp or git

subcommands.name: set-drush-version
subcommands.description: Set the version of Drush to be used on a specific environment or site
subcommands.longdesc:
[--site=<site>]
: The name of your site on Pantheon

[--env=<environment>]
: The Pantheon environment to change the Drush version of.
  Note: Leaving this blank will change the versions on all environments.

[--version=<version>]
: Drush version to use. Options are 5, 7, and 8.

subcommands.name: set-https-certificate
subcommands.description: Add/replace an HTTPS certificate for an environment
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Name of the site to apply the HTTPS certificate to

[--env=<env>]
: Environment of the site to apply the HTTPS certificate to

[--certificate=<value>]
: Certificate

[--private-key=<value>]
: RSA private key

[--intermediate-certificate=<value>]
: (optional) CA intermediate certificate(s)

subcommands.name: set-instrument
subcommands.description: Change the site payment instrument
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Site to use

[--instrument=<UUID>]
: Change the instrument by setting the ID

subcommands.name: set-owner
subcommands.description: Set the site owner
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Site to check

[--member=<email>]
: The email of the user to set as the new owner

subcommands.name: set-php-version
subcommands.description: Set the site's or environment's PHP version
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Site to set the PHP version on.

[--env=<env>]
: Environment to set the PHP version on. Leave this out to set only the
  site's version.

[--version=<php-version>]
: The PHP version to set the site or environment to. Options are 5.3 and
  5.5.

subcommands.name: set-service-level
subcommands.description: Set the site's service level
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Site to set the service level on

[--level=<value>]
: New service level to set. Options are free, basic, pro, and business.

subcommands.name: solr
subcommands.description: Enable or disable Solr indexing
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

<enable|disable>
: Options are enable and disable

[--site=<site>]
: Sitei on which to change Solr

subcommands.name: tags
subcommands.description: Manage site organization tags
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

<add|remove|list>
: subfunction to run

[--site=<site>]
: Site's name

[--org=<name|id>]
: Organization to apply tag with

[--tag=<tag>]
: Tag to add or remove

subcommands.name: team
subcommands.description: Get or set team members
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

<list|add-member|remove-member|change-role>
: Options are list, add-member, remove-member, and change-role.

[--site=<site>]
: Site to check

[--member=<email>]
: Email of the member to add. Member will receive an invite

[--role=<role>]
: Role to designate the member as. Options are developer, team_member,
  and admin.

subcommands.name: upstream-info
subcommands.description: Show upstream updates
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Site to check

subcommands.name: upstream-updates
subcommands.description: Show or apply upstream updates
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[<list|apply>]
: Are we inspecting or applying upstreams?

[--site=<site>]
: Site to check

[--env=<name>]
: Environment (dev or multidev) to apply updates to; Default: dev

[--accept-upstream]
: Attempt to automatically resolve conflicts in favor of the upstream
  repository.

[--updatedb]
: (Drupal only) run update.php after updating,

subcommands.name: wake
subcommands.description: Pings a site to ensure it responds
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: site to ping

[--env=<env>]
: environment to ping

## Examples
 terminus site wake --site='testsite' --env=dev

subcommands.name: wipe
subcommands.description: Complete wipe and reset a site
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Site to use

[--env=<env>]
: Environment to be wiped

subcommands.name: sites
subcommands.description: Actions on multiple sites

subcommands.name: aliases
subcommands.description: Print and save drush aliases
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--print]
: print aliases to screen

[--location=<location>]
: Specify the the full path, including the filename, to the alias file
  you wish to create. Without this option a default of
  '~/.drush/pantheon.aliases.drushrc.php' will be used.

subcommands.name: create
subcommands.description: Create a new site
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--site=<site>]
: Name of the site to create (machine-readable)

[--name=<name>]
: (deprecated) use --site instead

[--label=<label>]
: Label for the site

[--upstream=<upstreamid>]
: Specify the upstream upstream to use

[--org=<id>]
: UUID of organization into which to add this site

subcommands.name: import
subcommands.description: Import a new site
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--url=<url>]
: URL of archive to import

[--name=<name>]
: (deprecated) use --site instead

[--site=<site>]
: Name of the site to create (machine-readable)

[--label=<label>]
: Label for the site

[--org=<id>]
: UUID of organization into which to add this site

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: Show all sites user has access to
subcommands.longdesc:
Note: because of the size of this call, it is cached
  and also is the basis for loading individual sites by name

[--team]
: Filter for sites you are a team member of

[--owner]
: Filter for sites a specific user owns. Use "me" for your own user.

[--org=<id>]
: Filter sites you can access via the organization. Use 'all' to get all.

[--name=<regex>]
: Filter sites you can access via name

[--cached]
: Causes the command to return cached sites list instead of retrieving anew

subcommands.name: mass-update
subcommands.description: Update all dev sites with an available upstream update.
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

[--report]
: If set output will contain list of sites and whether they are up-to-date

[--upstream=<upstream>]
: Specify a specific upstream to check for updating.

[--no-updatedb]
: Use flag to skip running update.php after the update has applied

[--xoption=<theirs|ours>]
: Corresponds to git's -X option, set to 'theirs' by default
  -- https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/git-merge.html

[--tag=<tag>]
: Tag to filter by

[--org=<id>]
: Only necessary if using --tag. Organization which has tagged the site

[--cached]
: Set to prevent rebuilding of sites cache

subcommands.name: ssh-keys
subcommands.description: Show, add, and delete SSH keys on your Pantheon account

subcommands.name: add
subcommands.description: Add a SSH key to your account
subcommands.longdesc:
[--file=<filename>]
: The path specific SSH public key file to use

subcommands.name: delete
subcommands.description: Remove an SSH key from your account
subcommands.longdesc:
[--fingerprint=<fingerprint>]
: The fingerprint of the SSH key to remove

[--all]
: Use to remove all SSH keys from your account

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: Show a list of your SSH keys on Pantheon

subcommands.name: upstreams
subcommands.description: Show Pantheon upstream information

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: Search for Pantheon upstream info
subcommands.longdesc:
### OPTIONS

[--category=<category>]
: general, publishing, commerce, etc

[--type=<type>]
: Pantheon internal upstream type definition

[--framework=<drupal|wordpress>]
: Filter based on framework

subcommands.description: List Workflows for a Site

## OPTIONS

: Site from which to list workflows

subcommands.description: Show operation details for a workflow
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS
[--workflow-id=<workflow-id>]
: UUID of workflow to show
[--site=<site>]
: Site from which to list workflows
[--latest-with-logs]
: Display the most-recent workflow with logs

subcommands.name: watch
subcommands.description: Streams new and finished workflows to the console
subcommands.longdesc:
## OPTIONS

: Site from which to list workflows

subcommands.name: wp
subcommands.description: Invoke `wp` commands on a Pantheon development site
subcommands.longdesc:
<commands>...
: The WP-CLI command you intend to run with its arguments, in quotes

[--site=<site>]
: The name (DNS shortname) of your site on Pantheon

[--env=<environment>]
: Your Pantheon environment. Default: dev
